messages.message:
Before i raise a PFR, is this actually a regression?

JSON was getting pretty printed yesterday, but now is not.

Hmm, don't think we had the pretty printing of json previously either. We're just splitting the response by new line (\n) and displaying that - so in this case the model may not have added the new line characters to the response.

Btw, Subash is looking into adding a markdown renderer which will format this in a code block and should be much better.
Can we check the model response here ? Jsons should atleast get displayed in multiple  lines
@Matt Weaver Can you pls copy the response text from the chat window and post here? Possible edge case.. It worked for me here...

```{"divisions": [{"division": "Market Intelligence", "description": "global provider of multi-asset-class data and analytics integrated with purpose-built workflow solutions"}, {"division": "Ratings", "description": "independent provider of credit ratings, research, and analytics, offering investors and other market participants information, ratings and benchmarks"}, {"division": "Commodity Insights", "description": "leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodity and energy markets"}, {"division": "Mobility", "description": "provider of solutions serving the full automotive value chain including vehicle manufacturers (OEMs), automotive suppliers, mobility service providers, retailers, consumers, and finance and insurance companies"}, {"division": "Indices", "description": "global index provider maintaining a wide variety of valuation and index benchmarks for investment advisors, wealth managers and institutional investors"}, {"division": "Engineering Solutions", "description": "leading provider of engineering standards and related technical knowledge"}]}```
If the model generated indentations and right amount of spaces you would see it here, else you wouldn't
I think it's important that we are able to pretty print or render markdown correctly. Chat GPT does this as a default feature
Yes we are planning on adding many post-processing features we will include this in!

@Matt Weaver @Subash we now handle truncated jsons and format them correctly with markdown tags like back-ticked json : https://instabase.slack.com/files/U0175SZ13F0/F057KNLM3J5/screenshare_-_2023-05-11_3_42_19_am.webm
This will be available on next release of `ibllm`
@Subash would be great if we could render them like in chatgpt and provide a copy button so users can just copy it using that button
We are working on a markdown renderer. Should be coming soon
